The Governor's Provincial Promise Governor Cuomo's decision to close the prison at Pilgrim State Hospital on Long Island won't force any immediate crisis in the state correctional system. Prison expansion plans are on schedule with more than enough new cells opening elsewhere to accommodate the 500 prisoners there. But it's still a troubling decision. So clear a victory for the prison's opponents can only complicate future efforts to find sites for other unpopular but necessary facilities.

Drop Dead, Again ''My heart will not break,'' says Treasury Secretary Donald Regan, if New Yorkers lose the right to deduct billions in state and local taxes from their taxable incomes. His remark was not as callous as it sounds; he was talking about upper-income taxpayers. But the policy he proposes is callous. Indeed, it would be far more devastating than Washington's refusal to help during the 1975 fiscal crisis, which prompted the famous Daily News headline ''Ford to City: Drop Dead.''
